title: [FEATURE]Expose `SKImageInfo` of `SKCanvas` and `SKSurface`
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

`SkSurface.h` [contains](https://github.com/google/skia/blob/2f0f67b34de8b09b692d03dd135642a0ba9309f2/include/core/SkSurface.h#L526) the API to return an `SKImageInfo` but this is missing from the C# binding. The actual [implementation](https://github.com/google/skia/blob/2b62c1bf01fa5340e0dd891b0ca3bcb990c0f15f/src/image/SkSurface.cpp#L193) returns it from the canvas, which also [has](https://github.com/google/skia/blob/2f0f67b34de8b09b692d03dd135642a0ba9309f2/include/core/SkCanvas.h#L251) this API but this is also missing from the binding.

My problem is that when `SKSurface.PeekPixels` returns `null` so I need to use `SKSurface.ReadPixels` to create a raster copy of the surface I don't know what size the target pixmap should have.

The only workaround is to call `Snaphsot` first to create a temporary `SKImage`, which means an extra allocation.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Just like in case of `SKPixmap`, `SKBitmap` and `SKImage`, add a `public SKImageInfo Info { get; }` property to `SKSurface` and `SKCanvas`
